household air pollution.Description: Household air pollution is primarily caused by inefficient cooking stoves that release harmful pollutants into the air.
The use of solid fuels such as wood, coal, and dung for cooking and heating contributes to household air pollution.
Household air pollution has a significant impact on indoor air quality, leading to respiratory problems and other health issues.
Proper ventilation systems can help reduce household air pollution by improving air circulation and removing pollutants.
